alert.note: Alert for Central Colorado River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 14 at 2:05PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible, especially across the Grizzly Creek, Lake Christine and Pine Gulch Fire burn areas. Smaller burn scars within the watch area are also at risk. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following areas. In northwest Colorado, the Elkhead and Park Mountains, Flat Tops and Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus. In west central Colorado, the Central Colorado River Basin and the Gore and Elk Mountains/Central Mountain Valleys. * WHEN...From Friday morning through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. In addition, heavy rainfall over the Grizzly Creek, Lake Christine and Pine Gulch Fire burn areas, amongst others, is possible during the period of the watch. Residents and travellers near any of these burn areas should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An unusually potent surge of monsoon moisture is poised to sweep over the region on Friday. This combined with an upper level disturbance moving over northwest Colorado during the afternoon raises the threat of excessive rainfall which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows, particularly across recent burn areas.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Colorado River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus
